intro: Kohautia leucostoma, commonly known as the white-stemmed kohautia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that are clustered in panicles, typically blooming in spring. Kohautia leucostoma is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of New Zealand's native flora.
